messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ticks!!!!! How come them people trying to lure me too Minnesota failed to mention ticks!!! yuckyuckyuck Man, I loathe ticks. Shyrley
messages.messageBody:

> On Fri, 14 Feb 2003 21:12:27 -0800 (PST) Kelli Traaseth
> <kellitraas@...> writes:

> ***Of course to get to Minnesota!! <gg>***
>
> Hey! I was in Minnesota once when I was twelve or thirteen. My Aunt
> lived there and I remember walking to her out house and picking a dozen
> wood ticks off my socks and walking back to the house and picking a dozen
> more...
>

Ticks!!!!! How come them people trying to lure me too Minnesota failed to mention ticks!!!
yuckyuckyuck

Man, I loathe ticks.

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  Deb's posts/eelpout
messages.msgSnippet: Deborah Lewis  wrote: We have the Eelpout festival going on right now in Walker.  Some ... Is that ice fishing? Yep!   An eelpout is a big,
messages.messageBody:
Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:

We have the Eelpout festival going on right now in Walker. Some
> people really get into that!

Is that ice fishing?



Yep! An eelpout is a big, ugly, fish, kind-of a cross between a bull head and a cat fish!



Funny thing that happened last summer concerning an eelpout, my dd was scootering outside, my dh was standing back in the yard and happened to look up. There above my dd was an eagle passing by with an eelpout in its mouth, a second later another eagle swings by the first eagle and tries to steal the eelpout, it falls, just a few feet beside my daughter, SPLAT!! Man, was it big! My dh comes running in, Abbi almost got hit by an eelpout! We all laughed for days!



Kelli

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: On Sat, 15 Feb 2003 08:46:44 -0800 (PST) Kelli Traaseth ... That s like Montana.  I don t think we have as many as Minnesota, but there are some in early
messages.messageBody:
On Sat, 15 Feb 2003 08:46:44 -0800 (PST) Kelli Traaseth
<kellitraas@...> writes:

> I've only found that many ticks in May, seriously!

That's like Montana. I don't think we have as many as Minnesota, but
there are some in early spring and then we don't see any all year.

> I do love Minnesota, but I am struggling right now with the cold
> weather. I would be fine if I could get in a winter vacation
> (somewhere warm); unfortunately there's this thing called money that
> I have to worry about. <g>

Money? What's that? <g>

> I'm trying to stay positive about the winter activities that we have
> around here, but its hard when its below zero.

Yeah, that's too cold. Winter is wonderful if you can get out and enjoy
it but when you're locked up using all your energy to stay warm it gets
old. It's been mild enough here the past few winters that we get out
almost every day, for a walk at least but for sledding or skating or
snowshoeing sometimes too, without freezing our toes off.

> We have the Eelpout festival going on right now in Walker. Some
> people really get into that!

Is that ice fishing?

They have different fishing events here usually but the lake normally
used didn't bother to freeze hard enough this year.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: Shyrley  wrote: **Ticks!!!!! How come them people trying to lure me too Minnesota failed to mention ticks!!! yuckyuckyuck** They
messages.messageBody:
Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:

**Ticks!!!!! How come them people trying to lure me too Minnesota failed to mention ticks!!!
yuckyuckyuck**



They aren't that bad! Meaning they aren't everywhere and they aren't out all the time, especially when its -20! <g>



You can look at them under microscopes and its really cool, that's how I knew that there was a deer tick on my son.



Kelli, who knows her ticks <g>

> On Fri, 14 Feb 2003 21:12:27 -0800 (PST) Kelli Traaseth

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: Deborah Lewis  wrote: **I think they were in the Pillager area.** Hey that s not very far from me.   You should visit! I ve only found that
messages.messageBody:
Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:

**I think they were in the Pillager area.**



Hey that's not very far from me. You should visit!



I've only found that many ticks in May, seriously!



I do love Minnesota, but I am struggling right now with the cold weather. I would be fine if I could get in a winter vacation (somewhere warm); unfortunately there's this thing called money that I have to worry about. <g>



I'm trying to stay positive about the winter activities that we have around here, but its hard when its below zero.



We have the Eelpout festival going on right now in Walker. Some people really get into that!



Kelli






On Fri, 14 Feb 2003 21:12:27 -0800 (PST) Kelli Traaseth
<kellitraas@...> writes:

***Of course to get to Minnesota!! <gg>***

Hey! I was in Minnesota once when I was twelve or thirteen. My Aunt
lived there and I remember walking to her out house and picking a dozen
wood ticks off my socks and walking back to the house and picking a dozen
more...

But it was beautiful and warm and green and I woudn't mind seeing it
again. (uh, Minnesota, not the outhouse) I'm not such a wimp about wood
ticks now.

I think I still have long lost cousins there named Delameter. I don't
know if I'm spelling it right. I think they were in the Pillager area.
I'm old. I forget.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: **We re finding all kinds of reasons why a drive across eastern Montana and North Dakota would be a great adventure, ** Of course to get to Minnesota!!
messages.messageBody:
**We're finding all kinds of reasons why a drive across eastern
Montana and North Dakota would be a great adventure, **



Of course to get to Minnesota!! <gg>



Kelli





Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:*** It is in the very, very early stages. I really do think there would
be enough interest. And I do want to do it.***

Glad to hear it! It sounds daunting ~ boldly go where, blah, blah,
blah... But the rag tag group of Montana unschoolers would be so
grateful! We're finding all kinds of reasons why a drive across eastern
Montana and North Dakota would be a great adventure, not to mention the
wondrous first ever Fargo Unschoolers Conference!

***By the way I love your posts, do you know what one really stands
out in my mind as good? The one where you had drank some wine!<g> ***

Thanks! I don't remember that one...<g>
But hey! I'll meet you back here tonight with my little glass of
Boone's Farm and we'll see what spews forth!
Wear rain gear.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fargo conference, Deb's posts
messages.msgSnippet: Alright Deb,  thanks!        It is in the very, very early stages.   I really do think there would be enough interest.   And I do want to do it. As of right
messages.messageBody:
Alright Deb, thanks! It is in the very, very early stages. I really do think there would be enough interest. And I do want to do it.




As of right now I still feel like I'm so new to the unschooling community, but yet I truly have no doubts that it is the ideal life style for my family. I see wonderful changes occuring in our family as their school day memories diminish.


By the way I love your posts, do you know what one really stands out in my mind as good? The one where you had drank some wine!<g> It was great!

Kelli



Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote: Kelli,
Some folks from the Montana unschoolers list have expressed enthusiastic
interest in your potential unschooling conference in Fargo. I thought
I'd pass that along in the event you are collecting such information.

Deb L

messages.subject: The hope for a conference in Fargo
messages.msgSnippet: Kelli, Some folks from the Montana unschoolers list have expressed  enthusiastic interest in your potential  unschooling conference in Fargo.   I thought I d
messages.messageBody:
Kelli,
Some folks from the Montana unschoolers list have expressed enthusiastic
interest in your potential unschooling conference in Fargo. I thought
I'd pass that along in the event you are collecting such information.

Deb L
